flow.descriptionCdata:
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.00df594a-8f65-464b-b3fe-1a83b8a57727.prompt=Sitescope Protocol\: 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.0373b1e9-df72-4895-9617-bd7f1b69dc31.description=
Counts from one number to another number.

Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at
to - The number to count to
incrementBy - The amount to increment by during each count.
reset - If set to true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.06d1acb5-bc63-4730-8191-ed6e0698c80b.prompt=Enter a value for lockId 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.14efd3fc-28e9-48d7-9c0f-ed739961f513.description=
Sleeps for "X" seconds.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for "X" seconds.
failure - was unable to sleep for some reason
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.26b646a2-45d6-4b86-b7d9-856cfe293fad.prompt=Enter a value for lockId 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.2be37eac-9ed1-42d6-b699-66ebdb87bd55.prompt=Sitescope Host\: 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.36bf523b-0554-44c0-a874-bec48590d679.description=Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null. 
Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - if the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - if some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.5f6161ad-e982-4657-93c8-4a1f7569050e.prompt=Sitescope Port\: 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.612f546b-0ce5-46d0-86ae-09c24439080c.description=
Deploys a SiteScope template to a destination path

Inputs\:
hostname - The DNS name or IP Address of your SiteScope host.
port - The port to connect to your SiteScope host on.
protocol - The protocol to connect to your SiteScope host with (HTTP or HTTPS).  HTTPS is not configured by default during SiteScope install.
username - The username for the SiteScope host.
password - The password for the SiteScope user.
source - Source path (eg. Group\SubGroup, Group\Template). If seen in the UI, do not include the "SiteScope" root folder.
destination - Destination path (eg. Group\SubGroup).
variables - Template variables (eg. var1\=value|var2\=value2).
connectToServer - By default SiteScope will attempt to verify the object you are attempting to monitor is running. set to false to enable simulation mode with 10.11 and later.  (true or false. default is true).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Result of the operation
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.842b738c-7a5d-4419-bcbf-0b7123367ab0.description=Attempts to acquire the specified lock, and sleeps until the lock is available. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.
   timeout - The maximum number of seconds this flow will run for.
  seconds - The number of seconds to sleep for between each attempt at acquiring the lock.

Responses\:
   success - if the lock has been successfully acquired.
   failure - if the lock could not be acquired.

Result\:
   Code - 0 if the operation succeeds, 1 otherwise.

Notes\:
1) The locks acquired by this operation are not reentrant. This means that 
   once a lock is acquired by a run, all subsequent attempts at acquiring 
   the same lock by the same run (or any other run) will fail.

2) Once a run terminates, all the locks that were acquired during its execution
   are automatically released.
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.b3c83b9e-6712-4538-916f-9ac14de3134e.prompt=Enter password 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.description=
This flow runs Deploy Server Monitor action for created target VM on sitescope server. This flow creates a monitor entry for target VM in sitescope server. CSA templates must be deployed  and available in sitescope server before invoking this flow.

Inputs\:
serverIPAddress	\: The IP address of the provisioned vm
serverId		\: The server component Id
serverHostname	\: The host name of the provisioned vm
sisTemplatePath	\: The path of deployed csa template in your sitescope host (e.g \: CSA templates\LINUX)
monitorHost		\: The DNS name or IP address of your SiteScope host.
monitorPort 		\: The port to connect to your SiteScope host on.
monitorProtocol	\: The protocol to connect to your SiteScope host with (HTTP or HTTPS).  HTTPS is not configured by default during SiteScope install.
monitorUser		\: The username for the SiteScope host.
moitorPassword 	\: The password for the SiteScope user.
monitorPath		\: The complete monitor path to be created in sitescope server 
		  (e.g \: CSA Monitors\${reqOrgName}-${reqUserName}\${SVC_INSTANCE_ID}${hostname})
   

Response\:
success		\: Server monitor creation succeeded for the target VM in sitescope server
failure		\: Server monitor creation failed for the target VM in sitescope server
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.e7c0f138-5631-4568-bf6e-d37c72b83783.prompt=Enter a value for lockId 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.ed149c3a-2578-45f6-91b5-e2759627e490.prompt=Enter username 5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.efce8438-c885-4b34-af39-249d45a68797.description=Releases a lock with an id given by the value of the lockId input. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.

Responses\:
   success - the only response returned.

Results\:
   there are no results.

Notes\:
1) The operation only releases locks acquired by the current run. 
   It cannot release another run's locks.

2) The operation succeeds whether or not there is a lock held 
   by the current run with the supplied id.
5a70e8fb-1a0a-4673-bfc9-0f896474c8c1.f163ae45-8420-403f-a587-5bfe17b2a742.description=Releases a lock with an id given by the value of the lockId input. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.

Responses\:
   success - the only response returned.

Results\:
   there are no results.

Notes\:
1) The operation only releases locks acquired by the current run. 
   It cannot release another run's locks.

2) The operation succeeds whether or not there is a lock held 
   by the current run with the supplied id.
flow.name: Deploy Server Monitor

scriptlet.name: Step Deploy Template in Flow Deploy Server Monitor (612f546b-0ce5-46d0-86ae-09c24439080c)
